posts.post_content: It's cool that you get like free creature steal, but there's a number of ways to just kill it and get all your creatures back, nullifying it. You also can't use the creature it steals until the turn after it comes into your control. If you can protect it with maybe shielding plax or vines of vastwood then it could potentially do a lot. I wouldn't play it competitivley though at 6 mana, there's so many ways to remove it at that point in the game.

@KittySpit

I Also have a Blue/Green Landfall deck this is way playable in fact if I get this and another card (which I will reveal in a minute) I can take all there creatures lay down a creature to kill all of theres and it buffs me up a ton then next round I instantly win unless they have Wrath of god which makes me take out Reclaim which then I get my 2 cards back and I repeat the process

Mycoloth is the reason this strategy works he simply comes out devours all 4-10 of there creatures gets 2 +1/+1 counters for each one then next turn I get however many counters he has into 1/1 green creatures which I then use unsummon lay down mycoloth again and he just got twice as strong I mean there is no stopping my strategy ... Unless you have a protection from green blue deck or you have a ton of counters or you have a spell deck But other then that... lol

I played one opponent who was so impressed by my 12/12 tramplin' Lodestone Myr that that was what he stole on the next turn with his Roil Elemental, instead of my Broodstar. He was playing blue and green, and had one artifact in his deck. Even that wasn't out. Next turn, my 15/15 Broodstar might have felt a small bump underfoot.

posts.post_content:
unfortunately, a very easy card to remove. only a 4.5 though, cause you gotta have lands.
